data.title: Miles Moeller - Baseball
data.meta_description:
Miles Moeller (11) Left-Handed Pitcher  - 

2013 (Senior): Appeared in 22 games. . . earned first victory of the season in a 10-6, 12-inning win against Eastern
data.text:
2013 (Senior): Appeared in 22 games. . . earned first victory of the season in a 10-6, 12-inning win against Eastern Michigan (5/4) when he pitched three innings of one-hit baseball and struck out five. . .picked up second save of the season in the Cardinals' 4-3 win over Purdue (5/8)... finished the season with 20 strikeouts

2012 (Junior)

Appeared in 14 games, 13 out of the bullpen, to earn his first letter at Ball State ... Posted a 6.84 ERA in 26.1 innings of work ... Recorded a 1-2 record on the year with one save ... Worked a career-high 4.2 innings against Ohio (April 15), allowing two runs on six hits ... Picked up his first career victory with 3.0 innings of shutout relief at Akron (March 25) as he allowed just two hits ... Tallied 3.0 innings of solid relief against Eastern Michigan (April 20), allowing just one run on four hits to earn his first career save ... Appeared in eight Mid-American Conference games, including one start, while posting a 5.40 ERA in 20.0 innings of work.

Glendale CC

Two-year letterwinner at Glendale Community College for coach Paul Hatcher ... Posted a 5-5 record in two years working 77.2 innings and recording a 3.50 ERA ... Recorded 51 strikeouts and walked 30 batters in his career ... Posted a 5-2 record with a 2.90 ERA his sophomore year ... Tossed a complete game five-hitter in his final career game at Glendale CC against the No. 1 ranked junior college team in the country, Bakersfield.

High School

Four-year letterwinner at North Canyon High School for coach Jeff Tallmon ... Led his team to back-to-back conference championships as a junior and senior ... Posted a 6-4 record with a 3.30 ERA in 75.0 innings during his career ... Also recorded a .420 career batting average with 25 RBI, 60 runs scored and 30 stolen bases ... Named First Team All-Conference as a center fielder his senior year and First Team All-Conference as a first baseman his junior year ... Posted a .405 batting average as a senior with 20 stolen bases and 30 runs scored ... Tallied a 3-1 record in 36.0 innings while throwing a complete game his senior year ... Named Academic All-State as a senior ... Two-year letterwinner in basketball as a point guard ... National Honors Society member.

Personal

Studying physical therapy/pre-med ... Owns a 3.268 cumulative grade-point average on Ball State's 4.0 scale ... Managed a 3.022 GPA last fall ...Born June 3, 1991 ... Full name is Miles Daniel Moeller ... Son of Dan and Laura Moeller ... Has a twin brother, Dillon, and a sister Brianna.
